00029 #ifndef LUBYK_INCLUDE_MIMAS_TIMER_H_
00030 #define LUBYK_INCLUDE_MIMAS_TIMER_H_
00031 
00032 #include "mimas/mimas.h"
00033 
00034 #include <QtCore/QTimer.h>
00035 
00036 using namespace lubyk;
00037 
00038 namespace mimas {
00039 
00045 class Timer : public QTimer, public ThreadedLuaObject {
00046   Q_OBJECT
00047 public:
00048 
00051   Timer(int timeout)
00052       : QTimer(0)
00053   {
00054     setInterval(timeout);
00055     QObject::connect(this, SIGNAL(timeout()),
00056                      this, SLOT(timeoutSlot()));
00057 
00058     //printf("[%p] Timer\n", this);
00059     MIMAS_DEBUG_CC
00060   }
00061 
00062   virtual ~Timer() {
00063     //printf("[%p] ~Timer\n", this);
00064     MIMAS_DEBUG_GC
00065   }
00066 
00067   void start(int timeout) {
00068     QTimer::start(timeout);
00069   }
00070 
00071   void start() {
00072     QTimer::start();
00073   }
00074 
00075   void stop() {
00076     QTimer::stop();
00077   }
00078 
00079   void setInterval(int msec) {
00080     QTimer::setInterval(msec);
00081   }
00082 
00083 private slots:
00084   void timeoutSlot() {
00085     lua_State *L = lua_;
00086     if (pushLuaCallback("timeout")) {
00087       // <func> <self>
00088       int status = lua_pcall(L, 1, 0, 0);
00089 
00090       if (status) {
00091         // cannot raise an error here...
00092         fprintf(stderr, "Error in 'timeout': %s\n", lua_tostring(L, -1));
00093       }
00094     } else {
00095       printf("NO CALLBACK!\n");
00096     }
00097   }
00098 };
00099 
00100 } // mimas
00101 #endif // LUBYK_INCLUDE_MIMAS_TIMER_H_
